articles.headline: 2 Newcomers Jolt Parties’ Status Quo
articles.snippet: Senator Hillary Rodham Clinton and former Gov. Mitt Romney were brought low in Iowa on Thursday.
articles.abstract: Senator Hillary Rodham Clinton and former Gov. Mitt Romney were brought low in Iowa on Thursday.
articles.lead_paragraph: DES MOINES  The Democratic and Republican establishments and their presidential candidates, Senator Hillary Rodham Clinton and former Gov. Mitt Romney, were brought low in Iowa on Thursday night, shaken seriously by two national newcomers who won decisively on messages of insurgency and change.

articles.headline: Al Jazeera No Longer Nips at Saudis
articles.snippet: The newly cautious tone appears to have been dictated to Al Jazeera’s management by the rulers of Qatar.
articles.abstract: The newly cautious tone appears to have been dictated to Al Jazeera’s management by the rulers of Qatar.
articles.lead_paragraph: DUBAI, United Arab Emirates  When a Saudi court sentenced a young woman to 200 lashes in November after she pressed charges against seven men who had raped her, the case provoked outrage and headlines around the world, including in the Middle East.

articles.headline: New Face and a Call for Change Shake Up the Democratic Field
articles.snippet: Independents joined Democrats from all corners of Iowa to support Barack Obama’s improbable candidacy.
articles.abstract: Independents joined Democrats from all corners of Iowa to support Barack Obama’s improbable candidacy.
articles.lead_paragraph: DES MOINES   They rolled the dice.

articles.headline: Obama Takes Iowa in a Big Turnout as Clinton Falters; Huckabee Victor
articles.snippet: Senator Barack Obama was lifted to victory by a high turnout. On the Republican side, Mike Huckabee defeated the better financed Mitt Romney.
articles.abstract: Senator Barack Obama was lifted to victory by a high turnout. On the Republican side, Mike Huckabee defeated the better financed Mitt Romney.
articles.lead_paragraph: DES MOINES  Senator Barack Obama of Illinois, a first-term Democratic senator trying to become the nation’s first African-American president, rolled to victory in the Iowa caucuses on Thursday night, lifted by a record turnout of voters who embraced his promise of change.

articles.headline: Even Trucks Hit the Wall in an Erratic 2007
articles.snippet: Sales of pickup trucks, long a steady supplier of hefty profits to automakers, were slowed in 2007 by gas prices and housing ills.
articles.abstract: Sales of pickup trucks, long a steady supplier of hefty profits to automakers, were slowed in 2007 by gas prices and housing ills.
articles.lead_paragraph: DETROIT  They may be built like a rock, be able to haul boulders and hail from deep in the heart of Texas. But pickup tricks cannot stand up to tough economic times.

articles.headline: Parent of Dating Sites Looks for a Match
articles.snippet: The parent company of the popular Jewish online dating site JDate has put itself up for sale, people close to the auction said Thursday, and is already in talks with several prominent media companies.
articles.abstract: The parent company of the popular Jewish online dating site JDate has put itself up for sale, people close to the auction said Thursday, and is already in talks with several prominent media companies.
articles.lead_paragraph: Wanted: Single dot-com Yenta seeks ambitious Mr. Big with deep pockets for a long-term relationship.

articles.headline: State Street Corp. Is Sued Over Pension Fund Losses
articles.snippet: State Street ousted a senior executive and said it would set aside $618 million to cover legal claims stemming from investments tied to mortgage securities.
articles.abstract: State Street ousted a senior executive and said it would set aside $618 million to cover legal claims stemming from investments tied to mortgage securities.
articles.lead_paragraph: The State Street Corporation, which manages $2 trillion for pension funds and other institutions, ousted a senior executive on Thursday and said it would set aside $618 million to cover legal claims stemming from investments tied to mortgage securities.

articles.headline: Strikers Complain as Leno Dominates Late-Night
articles.snippet: The Writers Guild of America moved to try to prevent Jay Leno from performing any more monologues.
articles.abstract: The Writers Guild of America moved to try to prevent Jay Leno from performing any more monologues.
articles.lead_paragraph: Jay Leno made a triumphant return to late-night television Wednesday night, easily dominating the ratings competition over his chief rival, David Letterman, and delivering a traditional full-length monologue  even though he was performing without his team of 19 writers.
articles.byline: By Bill Carter and Brian Stelter

articles.headline: Now You See Those Securities, Now You Don’t
articles.snippet: The days before New Year’s are prime time for banks to try and appear healthier than they really are and for money managers to ditch dubious-looking securities from their portfolios.
articles.abstract: The days before New Year’s are prime time for banks to try and appear healthier than they really are and for money managers to ditch dubious-looking securities from their portfolios.
articles.lead_paragraph: What better time of year is there than New Year’s Eve to release some bad news?
